item.title: Continued illegal parking particularly dangerously on Wednesdays, 13th November
item.description:
This illegal and dangerous parking on yellow lines, paths, the bend, and Zig zag markings need to be dealt with before someone is hurt. Throughout the week it continues with the drop down kerb being blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, White Oak, Swanley

item.title: Dead leaves, litter, trash, overflowing bins!, 13th November
item.description:
Whole of Hackney Road is covered in dead leaves making it impossible to walk without slipping hazards. Furthermore all bins are overflowing. There's loads of litter, trash bags everywhere. The whole street from one end to the other is a neglected disaster

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hackney Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Beech Tree needs pruning, 13th November
item.description:
Hi BC, Could you please prune the lower branches on the first Beech tree on Gundulph Road (coming from Homesdale Road) as it has really low overhanging branches and no-one wants to park underneath it as the branches damage the cars. This would free up 2 car parking spaces on this road easing a bit of the parking congestion. Thankyou!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gundulph Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress dumped outside garage no 9 on Ancona Road, Broken Glass, Bottles strewn on pavement, Black sacks dumped and now open, 13th November
item.description:
Mattress dumped outside garage number 9 on Ancona Rd. Black sacks discarded and opened possibly by foxes. Street unswept for weeks, general rubbish strewn on road. The headteacher has been promised by one of the bin lorry drivers that they will return to collect the rubbish.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walmer Terrace, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a unacceptable of flytipping at this location at Hilborough court e8, 13th November
item.description:
Hello hackney Council there is unacceptable levels of flytipping at this location hilborough court e8 4lg. This has been like this for some time and needs urgent cleaning. Thank you Hackney Council for being part of fixing, cleaning and maintenance.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albion Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole assault course, 13th November
item.description:
Again, Bexley close off tickets without doing any work. This road is still riddled with dangerous potholes to the point we are seeing drivers swerving in the road into the cycle lane and nearly knocking someone off their bike. Are the council waiting for a death to occur before actually doing something?! Can you please fix these!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and rubbish on Alkham Road - HAS NOT BEEN CLEANED, 13th November
item.description:
The report ref: 8388260 shows as closed. However it has not been done. There is still pavements blocked by leaves on both sides of Alkham Road, near Cazenove Road. It has been over a month of no street cleaning on these corners. Photos from 4.50pm 12 Nov

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alkham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, cans, plastic bottles etc all along the curb where cars are parked, 13th November
item.description:
There is a line of rubbish including cans and bottles along the curb where the cars are parked on White Hart Road, adjacent to Broomhill Road, next to the fence for 10 Broomhill Rd. The previous report was closed without action but the rubbish is still there. It is on the pavement and in the gutter all along the road, by the parked cars in White Hart Road next to the fence for 10 Broomhill Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hart Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
